info.title: Passage by 1Password - Auth
info.description: Passage is backed by 1Password's 17+ years of industry-leading security expertise. Completely replace your existing authentication flow or build from scratch with a robust solution for passwordless authentication and customer identity management. Realize the full security, business, and user experience benefits of eliminating passwords by implementing login flows powered by passkeys, magic links, and login codes.

get.description: Retrieve JWKS for an app. KIDs in the JWT can be used to match the appropriate JWK, and use the JWK's public key to verify the JWT.
Retrieve OpenID configuration for an app.
Retrieve information about a user that is currently authenticated via bearer token.
Retrieve a list of all WebAuthn devices for the authenticated user. User must be authenticated via bearer token.

post.description: Completes a WebAuthn add device operation for the current user. User must be authenticated via a bearer token.

Initiate a WebAuthn add device operation for the current user. This endpoint creates a WebAuthn credential creation challenge that is used to perform the registration ceremony from the browser. User must be authenticated via a bearer token.

delete.description: Revoke a device by ID for the current user. User must be authenticated via a bearer token.

patch.description: Updates a device by ID for the current user. Currently the only field that can be updated is the friendly name. User must be authenticated via a bearer token.
Initiate an email change for the authenticated user. An email change requires verification, so an email will be sent to the user which they must verify before the email change takes effect.

Initiate a phone number change for the authenticated user. A phone number change requires verification, so an SMS with a link will be sent to the user which they must verify before the phone number change takes effect.

get.description: Retrieve the user-metadata for the current user.

patch.description: Updates the metadata for the current user. Only valid metadata fields are accepted. Invalid metadata fields that are present will abort the update. User must be authenticated via a bearer token.

post.description: Send a login email or SMS to the user. The user will receive an email or text with a link to complete their login.
Completes a WebAuthn login and authenticate the user.
Initiate a WebAuthn login for a user. This endpoint creates a WebAuthn credential assertion challenge that is used to perform the login ceremony from the browser.

patch.description: Authenticates a magic link for a user. This endpoint checks that the magic link is valid, then returns an authentication token for the user.

post.description: Check if a magic link has been activated yet or not. Once the magic link has been activated, this endpoint will return an authentication token for the user. This endpoint can be used to initiate a login on one device and then poll and wait for the login to complete on another device.
Create a user and send an registration email or SMS to the user. The user will receive an email or text with a link to complete their registration.
Completes a WebAuthn registration and authenticate the user.

post.summary: Create new auth and refresh token
post.description: Creates and returns a new auth token and a new refresh token.

get.description: Retrieve user information, if the user exists. This endpoint can be used to determine whether a user has an existing account and if they should login or register.

get.summary: Link an account to a connection
get.description: Links an existing account to an OAuth2 connection.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: The code given from the OAuth2 redirect.

parameters.name: verifier
parameters.description: The verifier the client originally sent to the OAuth2 provider.

get.description: Kicks off an OAuth2 flow with connection provider request params described in https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#AuthRequest

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description: The URL to redirect to after the OAuth2 flow is complete.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: The state to pass through to the redirect URI.

parameters.name: connection_type
parameters.description: Connection type; google, github, apple, or passage to login with.

get.description: Exchanges OAuth2 connection data for an auth token.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: The code given from the OAuth2 redirect.

parameters.name: verifier
parameters.description: The verifier the client originally sent to the OAuth2 provider.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: The authorization code returned by the OAuth2 provider.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: The state returned by the OAuth2 provider.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: The error returned by the OAuth2 provider.

parameters.name: error_description
parameters.description: The error description returned by the OAuth2 provider.

post.description: Send a login email or SMS to the user. The user will receive an email or text with a one-time passcode to complete their login.
Create a user and send a registration email or SMS to the user. The user will receive an email or text with a one-time passcode to complete their registration.
Authenticates a one-time passcode for a user. This endpoint checks that the one-time passcode is valid, then returns an authentication token for the user.
Initiate a WebAuthn registration and create the user. This endpoint creates a WebAuthn credential creation challenge that is used to perform the registration ceremony from the browser.

get.description: Gets social connections for the current user. User must be authenticated via a bearer token.

delete.description: Deletes a social connection for the current user. User must be authenticated via a bearer token.

id.description: The credential's identifier. The requirements for the identifier are distinct for each type of credential. It might represent a username for username/password tuples, for example.
id.title: ID

type.description: The value of the object's interface object's [[type]] slot, which specifies the credential type represented by this object. This should be type "public-key" for Webauthn credentials.
type.title: Type

id.description: The credential's identifier. The requirements for the identifier are distinct for each type of credential. It might represent a username for username/password tuples, for example.
id.title: ID

type.description: The value of the object's interface object's [[type]] slot, which specifies the credential type represented by this object. This should be type "public-key" for Webauthn credentials.
type.title: Type

auth_fallback_method.title: Auth Fallback Method

auth_fallback_method_ttl.title: Auth Fallback Method TTL

client_id.description: The client ID of the OAuth2 social connection.
client_id.title: Client ID

passage_container_background_color.description: Container background color in hex. Default is `#ffffff` in light mode & `#383838` in dark mode.
passage_container_background_color.title: Passage Container Background Color

passage_input_box_background_color.description: Input box background color in hex. Default is `#ffffff` in light mode & `#4b4b4b` in dark mode.
passage_input_box_background_color.title: Passage Input Box Background Color

passage_header_text_color.description: Header text color in hex. Default is `#222222` in light mode & `#f3f3f3` in dark mode.
passage_header_text_color.title: Passage Header Text Color

passage_body_text_color.description: Body text color in hex. Default is `#222222` in light mode & `#f3f3f3` in dark mode.
passage_body_text_color.title: Passage Body Text Color

passage_secondary_button_text_color.title: Passage Secondary Secondary Buttn Text Color

passage_secondary_button_hover_color.title: Passage Secondary Button Backgroun on Hover

ttl.description: Maximum time (IN SECONDS) for the auth to expire.

ttl.description: Maximum time (IN SECONDS) for the auth to expire.

TtlDisplayUnit.description: Deprecated Property. The preferred unit for displaying the TTL. This value is for display only. * `s` - seconds * `m` - minutes * `h` - hours * `d` - days .
TtlDisplayUnit.title: TTL Display Unit

attestationObject.description: Attestation object is the byte slice version of attestationObject. This attribute contains an attestation object, which is opaque to, and cryptographically protected against tampering by, the client. The attestation object contains both authenticator data and an attestation statement. The former contains the AAGUID, a unique credential ID, and the credential public key. The contents of the attestation statement are determined by the attestation statement format used by the authenticator. It also contains any additional information that the relying party's server requires to validate the attestation statement, as well as to decode and validate the authenticator data along with the JSON-serialized client data.
attestationObject.title: Attestation Object

clientDataJSON.description: This attribute contains a JSON serialization of the client data passed to the authenticator by the client in its call to either create() or get().
clientDataJSON.title: Client Data JSON

clientDataJSON.description: This attribute contains a JSON serialization of the client data passed to the authenticator by the client in its call to either create() or get().
clientDataJSON.title: Client Data JSON

e.description: The exponent for the standard pem.
e.title: Exponent

kid.description: The unique identifier for the key.
kid.title: Key ID

n.description: The modulus for a standard pem.
n.title: Modulus

use.description: How the key is meant to be used (i.e. 'sig' represents signature)
use.title: Use

userVerification.description: This member describes the relying party's requirements regarding user verification for the create() operation. Eligible authenticators are filtered to only those capable of satisfying this requirement.
userVerification.title: User Verification

authenticatorAttachment.description: If this member is present, eligible authenticators are filtered to only authenticators attached with the specified AuthenticatorAttachment enum.
authenticatorAttachment.title: Authenticator Attachment

requireResidentKey.description: This member describes the relying party's requirements regarding resident credentials. If the parameter is set to true, the authenticator MUST create a client-side-resident public key credential source when creating a public key credential.
requireResidentKey.title: Require Resident Key

residentKey.description: This member describes the relying party's requirements regarding resident credentials per Webauthn Level 2.
residentKey.title: Resident Key

userVerification.description: This member describes the relying party's requirements regarding user verification for the create() operation. Eligible authenticators are filtered to only those capable of satisfying this requirement.
userVerification.title: User Verification

id.description: The ID of a credential to allow/disallow.
id.title: ID

transports.description: The authenticator transports that can be used.
transports.title: Transports

icon.description: A serialized URL which resolves to an image associated with the entity. For example, this could be a user's avatar or a relying party's logo. This URL MUST be an a priori authenticated URL. Authenticators MUST accept and store a 128-byte minimum length for an icon member's value. Authenticators MAY ignore an icon member's value if its length is greater than 128 bytes. The URL's scheme MAY be "data" to avoid fetches of the URL, at the cost of needing more storage.  Deprecated: this has been removed from the specification recommendations.
icon.title: Icon

id.description: A unique identifier for the relying party entity, which sets the RP ID.
id.title: ID

name.description: A human-palatable name for the entity. Its function depends on what the PublicKeyCredentialEntity represents:  When inherited by PublicKeyCredentialRpEntity it is a human-palatable identifier for the relying party, intended only for display. For example, "ACME Corporation", "Wonderful Widgets, Inc." or "ОАО Примертех".  When inherited by PublicKeyCredentialUserEntity, it is a human-palatable identifier for a user account. It is intended only for display, i.e., aiding the user in determining the difference between user accounts with similar displayNames. For example, "alexm", "alex.p.mueller@example.com" or "+14255551234".
name.title: Name

displayName.description: A human-palatable name for the user account, intended only for display. The relying party SHOULD let the user choose this, and SHOULD NOT restrict the choice more than necessary.
displayName.title: Display Name

icon.description: A serialized URL which resolves to an image associated with the entity. For example, this could be a user's avatar or a relying party's logo. This URL MUST be an a priori authenticated URL. Authenticators MUST accept and store a 128-byte minimum length for an icon member's value. Authenticators MAY ignore an icon member's value if its length is greater than 128 bytes. The URL's scheme MAY be "data" to avoid fetches of the URL, at the cost of needing more storage.  Deprecated: this has been removed from the specification recommendations.
icon.title: Icon

id.description: The user handle of the user account entity. To ensure secure operation, authentication and authorization decisions MUST be made on the basis of this id member, not the displayName nor name members. See Section 6.1 of [RFC8266](https://www.w3.org/TR/webauthn/#biblio-rfc8266).
id.title: ID

name.description: A human-palatable name for the entity. Its function depends on what the PublicKeyCredentialEntity represents:  When inherited by PublicKeyCredentialRpEntity it is a human-palatable identifier for the relying party, intended only for display. For example, "ACME Corporation", "Wonderful Widgets, Inc." or "ОАО Примертех".  When inherited by PublicKeyCredentialUserEntity, it is a human-palatable identifier for a user account. It is intended only for display, i.e., aiding the user in determining the difference between user accounts with similar displayNames. For example, "alexm", "alex.p.mueller@example.com" or "+14255551234".
name.title: Name

x-ms-openai-manifest.modelDescription: This is a Copilot plugin for the Passage by 1Password authentication service.
